So I called back, talked to a guy who asked me to email our order, so I did that. 25 minutes later and no email response, my coworker called them to make sure our order was placed and they had no idea what she was talking about.  They finally figured it out and said it would be here shortly. It did arrive (by a very nice delivery guy), but we hadn't paid yet, and he had no idea about that and had no way to process payment.  I was finally able to give my payment over the phone, and when we got back to the office, the 2 sandwiches that had special requests (no onions, etc) were regular ones with no sauce at all and we're all that great :( It was pretty disappointing since we were all craving bahn mi so bad that day!
author: Sheena C.

description: In a place like San Francisco there are so many better options for authentic banh mi.  Ordered the lemon grass pork sandwich with pate.  The bread was decent but I wish it was toasted.  The meat wash very tasty but the pickled veggies were so bland they spoiled an otherwise decent sandwich.  Despite the bad veggies I'd give the place three stars for the yummy meat if the sandwich was not so overpriced.  Do yourself a favor and pick up a real banh mi for $4.50 in the tenderloin.  Oh, the restaurant looks cool, I'll give them that.
author: Martin B.

description: I had a noodle bowl with tofu. The food was good but they also included 2 pork spring rolls with my meal. Since I ordered a vegetarian entree I was they would have offered vegetarian rolls.
author: Angela H.

description: convenient to get quality fast food to go in this right location. except the smell..... open kitchen and the usual heavy greasy cooking style in Asian restaurant..... have to spray some fabric refresher immediately in order to get rid that sour/sweet/spicy/salty taste on clothes.....
author: Freya-Loki O.

description: WOW!!! This is the best place in town! You can't go wrong with any items on the menu, hoping they set up another shop in Marin! Great service as well! Try there pork and shrimp summer roll, and there 5 spice chicken salad!
author: Michael B.

description: I went here for lunch and this place is fantastic!  The catfish sandwich was delicious, really amazing food!  Very cool decor, great atmosphere and the blonde manger was very helpful.  Highly recommend!
author: SKY S.

description: I was looking forward to their pork and shrimp fresh spring roll.  After picking up my order and taking it home, I realized that they had left the pork out completely.  You get two spring rolls per order and they cut them in half - making 4 half pieces.  Two of the half pieces of the spring roll didn't even have shrimp in it.  Such a disappointment as I was really looking forward to eating it.
author: Emily L.

description: Their coconut cookies are good, but I wasn't a fan of my bowl. Long lunch lines, chicken didn't seem that fresh, food was expensive, and wasn't that good. There are better options a few blocks away in Chinatown.
author: Kristen C.

description: def a decent bahn mi ... but a little over priced .. bahn mi's are supposed to be cheap street food at around 4-5$ .... this place charges 7-10$
author: Micah W.

description: Fail.  I tried the grilled pork.  It had very little flavor, big chewy pieces of fat, and tasted like it was boiled instead of grilled.  The place was a mad house, very loud, pushing and shoving, no place to wait for a to go order, and over priced.  On top of the premium price, they also add on a fee for healthy San Francisco.  Avoid this place and go almost anywhere else for a better bahn mi for at least $2 less.  I will never return to this place.
author: mark f.

description: Food is great and they have really turned around their service. Manager is a class act who knows customers names and keeps things moving!
author: SF H.

description: With a drink and a sandwich my bill was around 12 bucks - to which I felt compelled to add a 2 dollar tip.  Ouch, that's double my typical lunch cost.  The veggies and meat were good, the bread was passable.  I paid the extra dollar to have a swipe of pâté with my lemongrass pork.  The flavor was all there, though the pâté appeared to have some intact organs instead of being fully "pasted".  Par for the SF course, an assembly line of un-asian, jeans wearing, tatooed and pierced teens were slapping my Vietnamese style sandwich together.  One particularly cute little blonde girl busily rushed orders out to tables and handed out the to go orders.  It looked like a fairly efficient operation as they jammed through the FiDi lunch crowd that had lined up behind me (I just beat the main rush).  Taste wise I could give it 4 stars, since  by local comparison - there are some truly bad sannies made in this neighborhood.  It certainly beats the snot out of Lee's.  With the high cost though, I can't really justify a return trip and will have to knock it down to 3 stars.  Vespa scooter stickers on the sandwich wrapper were a nice touch though.
author: Ho H.

description: Came here due to a few rave reviews and its just around the corner from work so I figured why not. I ordered the Juicy Steak but was left incredibly disappointed, the sandwich was very messy, the steak was very chewy (and not juicy at all); the first bite was ok but I got bored of the sandwich very quickly since it just lacked the flavor I was looking for and didn't end up finishing it. I had also ordered the salt and pepper garlic fries which I thought were simply terrible, soggy fries and way too much salt. Went there with a friend who had the Grilled Lemongrass Pork and he came to the same conclusion as me, bland sandwich and bad fries. If you want a tasty Banh Mi that is also affordable, stick to the tenderloin.
author: Ed H.

description: It was only the second day so things were a little bit chaotic. Only 2 registers were open and although there was just one person ahead of me, it seemed to take longer than it should. I do agree it is a little loud - you have to pay attention or you will miss your name being called out when your food is ready. I ordered the crispy fish sandwich.  Fish was tasty but not crispy at all. Bread was dense and chewy, I would have prepared a little softer roll with a crusty exterior. The sandwich was a little small. The ratio of bread to the other ingredients seemed wrong. Perhaps I am thinking of Saigon Sandwich? No comparison of course and by the look of things a welcome addition to the neighborhood.I plan to try the other sandwiches before I decide if it is going to be a regular stop.
author: rojak g.

description: Delicious! This place is always packed at lunchtime, but the sandwiches are tasty.  It's a bit pricey for my taste, but was totally worth it for a lunchtime treat!
author: Emily V.

description: I just got back from a trip to Vietnam and I love bun mee's approach to Vietnamese street food. Friendly staff, quick service, and warm delicious food.
author: Kysha S.

description: It was just Okay, bread was tough and juicy steak was not that juicy.  But by all means try for yourself, but, I've had better.
author: Justin S.
